intro: Elaeocarpus nouhuysii, commonly known as the New Guinea elaeocarpus, is a tropical tree native to the island of New Guinea. It belongs to the family Elaeocarpaceae and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and showy, white to pink flowers. The plant produces small, fleshy berries that are an important food source for various bird species. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland and montane forests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
